alert.note: Alert for Carlton (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 9:33PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... St. Louis River at Scanlon affecting Carlton County. .Light to moderate rain earlier Saturday on top of the existing snowpack will increase the rate of runoff. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. For the Western Lake Superior...including Scanlon...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Louis River at Scanlon. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water encroaches buildings near River Gate Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM CDT Saturday was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.7 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 04/23/1979. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue St. Louis River Scanlon 10.5 13.0 Sat 8 pm CDT 13.7 13.3 12.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon by 400 PM CDT.
